definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain

sentences.english: Now that the exam is near, the students are really going at their studies.
sentences.chinese: 考期临近了，所以学生们确实在刻苦钻研。

sentences.english: She is digging away at her mathematics lessons.
sentences.chinese: 她在不停地刻苦钻研数学。

sentences.english: She said that she would dig at American literature for her exam next year.
sentences.chinese: 她说她一定要刻苦钻研美国文学以应付明年的考试。

sentences.english: His erudition comes from his assiduous study.
sentences.chinese: 他的博学来自他的刻苦钻研。

sentences.english: Worker who are monitoring transportation should improve their working skills.
sentences.chinese: 交通监理人员要刻苦钻研业务技术。

sentences.english: We must apply ourselves to economic work.
sentences.chinese: 我们要刻苦钻研经济工作。

sentences.english: He is hammering at his studies recently.
sentences.chinese: 他最近正在刻苦钻研他的学业。

sentences.english: He studied hard that he might serve the country well.
sentences.chinese: 为了很好地为祖国服务，他刻苦钻研。

sentences.english: He is grinding away at French study.
Urges me to the computer strong interest attentively to study, studies assiduously.
sentences.chinese: 对计算机的浓厚兴趣则促使我用心学习，刻苦钻研。

definition: to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
